title: Samson and Delilah
shortSummary: Judges 16 recounts the tragic downfall of Samson, Israel's last judge, through his relationship with Delilah, who betrays him to the Philistines. The chapter highlights the consequences of disobedience to God’s commands and ends with Samson’s final act of faith and deliverance through God’s strength.
timeline: c. 1100 BC - Period of the Judges in Israel

keyCharacters.name: Samson
keyCharacters.description: A Nazirite judge of Israel known for his supernatural strength, which he loses after revealing the secret of his strength to Delilah.

keyCharacters.name: Delilah
keyCharacters.description: A woman from the valley of Sorek who is bribed by the Philistine lords to discover the secret of Samson’s strength and betray him.

keyCharacters.name: Lords of the Philistines
keyCharacters.description: Philistine rulers who seek to capture Samson and use Delilah to uncover the source of his strength.

keyCharacters.name: Manoah’s family
keyCharacters.description: Samson’s relatives who later retrieve and bury him after his death.

definitions.definition: A woman who engages in sexual immorality; in this context, a prostitute.
A person consecrated to God by a special vow involving abstaining from wine, not cutting hair, and avoiding contact with the dead.
Flexible branches or twigs used for binding or tying.
Chains or shackles used to bind a prisoner’s hands or feet.

outline.heading: Samson’s Feat at Gaza
outline.description: Samson visits Gaza and is surrounded by enemies who plan to kill him, but he displays his supernatural strength by carrying away the city gate, demonstrating God’s empowerment.

outline.heading: Samson’s Love for Delilah
outline.description: Samson falls in love with Delilah, who is approached by the Philistine lords to discover the secret of his strength, setting the stage for his betrayal.

outline.heading: Delilah’s Attempts to Discover Samson’s Secret
outline.description: Delilah repeatedly entices Samson to reveal the source of his strength, and after several failed attempts, he finally confesses that his strength lies in his uncut hair, leading to his capture.

outline.heading: Samson’s Capture and Humiliation
outline.description: The Philistines blind Samson and imprison him, celebrating their victory over Israel’s judge, illustrating the consequences of Samson’s disobedience and compromised faith.

outline.heading: Samson’s Final Act and Death
outline.description: In a final prayer to God, Samson regains strength and brings down the temple of Dagon, killing many Philistines and himself, fulfilling his role as judge and deliverer of Israel.

application: Guard your heart and be cautious in relationships, as intimacy can lead to spiritual vulnerability and compromise.
Do not reveal or misuse the gifts and blessings God has given you; protect what God has entrusted to you.
In times of weakness and failure, call upon God for strength and restoration, trusting in His mercy and power.
Remember that God can use even our failures and sufferings to accomplish His purposes and bring deliverance.

keyVerses.text: That he told her all his heart, and said unto her, There hath not come a razor upon mine head; for I have been a Nazarite unto God from my mother's womb: if I be shaven, then my strength will go from me, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the source of Samson’s strength and his Nazarite vow, highlighting the importance of faithfulness to God’s commands.

keyVerses.text: And she said, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he awoke out of his sleep, and said, I will go out as at other times before, and shake myself. And he wist not that the LORD was departed from him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the spiritual consequence of Samson’s disobedience—God’s departure and loss of strength.

keyVerses.text: And Samson called unto the LORD, and said, O Lord GOD, remember me, I pray thee, and strengthen me, I pray thee, only this once, O God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes.
keyVerses.significance: Samson’s prayer demonstrates repentance and dependence on God’s power for deliverance even in his final moments.

keyVerses.text: And Samson said, Let me die with the Philistines. And he bowed himself with all his might; and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that were therein. So the dead which he slew at his death were more than they which he slew in his life.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights Samson’s ultimate sacrifice and God’s judgment on Israel’s enemies through him.
